kwargs.content: You are an experienced xml developer, who specializes in migrating code from spring5 to eap and eap8 and jakarta-ee and jakarta-ee9+ and jws and jws6+ and spring6+

I will give you a spring5 file for which I want to take one step towards migrating to eap and eap8 and jakarta-ee and jakarta-ee9+ and jws and jws6+ and spring6+.

I will provide you with static source code analysis information highlighting an issue which needs to be addressed.

Fix all the issues described. Other problems will be solved in subsequent steps so it is unnecessary to handle them now.

Before attempting to migrate the code to eap and eap8 and jakarta-ee and jakarta-ee9+ and jws and jws6+ and spring6+ reason through what changes are required and why.

Pay attention to changes you make and impacts to external dependencies in the pom.xml as well as changes to imports we need to consider.

Remember when updating or adding annotations that the class must be imported.

As you make changes that impact the pom.xml or imports, be sure you explain what needs to be updated.

After you have shared your step by step thinking, provide a full output of the updated file.

# Input information

## Input File

File name: "persistence.xml"
Source file contents:
```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<persistence version="3.0"
             xmlns="https://jakarta.ee/xml/ns/persistence" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
             xsi:schemaLocation="
        https://jakarta.ee/xml/ns/persistence
        https://jakarta.ee/xml/ns/persistence/persistence_3_0.xsd">
    <persistence-unit name="primary">
        <jta-data-source>java:jboss/datasources/CoolstoreDS</jta-data-source>
        <properties>
            <property name="jakarta.persistence.schema-generation.database.action" value="none"/>
            <property name="hibernate.show_sql" value="false" />
            <property name="hibernate.format_sql" value="true" />
            <property name="hibernate.use_sql_comments" value="true" />
            <property name="hibernate.jdbc.use_get_generated_keys" value="false" />
        </properties>
    </persistence-unit>
</persistence>
```

## Issues


### incident 0
incident to fix: "Rename properties prefixed by `javax` with `jakarta`"
Line number: 10



# Output Instructions
Structure your output in Markdown format such as:

## Reasoning
Write the step by step reasoning in this markdown section. If you are unsure of a step or reasoning, clearly state you are unsure and why.

## Updated xml File
```xml
// Write the updated file in this section. If the file should be removed, make the content of the updated file a comment explaining it should be removed.
```

## Additional Information (optional)

If you have any additional details or steps that need to be performed, put it here.

## Reasoning
The issue to be fixed is related to renaming properties prefixed by `javax` with `jakarta`. This is because the application is being migrated to Jakarta EE, which has replaced the `javax` namespace with `jakarta`.

In the given `persistence.xml` file, the property `jakarta.persistence.schema-generation.database.action` already uses the `jakarta` prefix, so it does not need to be changed.

However, the properties prefixed with `hibernate` are not directly related to the `javax` to `jakarta` migration. But, we should note that the `hibernate` properties might need to be adjusted in future steps, depending on the specific requirements of the migration.

No changes are required to the `pom.xml` file or imports in this step, as we are only updating the `persistence.xml` file.

## Updated xml File
```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<persistence version="3.0"
             xmlns="https://jakarta.ee/xml/ns/persistence" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
             xsi:schemaLocation="
        https://jakarta.ee/xml/ns/persistence
        https://jakarta.ee/xml/ns/persistence/persistence_3_0.xsd">
    <persistence-unit name="primary">
        <jta-data-source>java:jboss/datasources/CoolstoreDS</jta-data-source>
        <properties>
            <property name="jakarta.persistence.schema-generation.database.action" value="none"/>
            <property name="hibernate.show_sql" value="false" />
            <property name="hibernate.format_sql" value="true" />
            <property name="hibernate.use_sql_comments" value="true" />
            <property name="hibernate.jdbc.use_get_generated_keys" value="false" />
        </properties>
    </persistence-unit>
</persistence>
```

## Additional Information (optional)
No additional changes are required in this step. However, in future steps, we might need to update the `hibernate` properties or add new properties to support the migration to Jakarta EE. Additionally, we should review the `pom.xml` file to ensure that the necessary dependencies are included to support the migration.
